medical_history.chief_complaint: Fever, chills, nausea, and left flank pain over the site of renal transplant.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began with fever to 100.2 this morning, along with chills and nausea. The left flank pain has been present for 3 days. Patient denies any dysuria, frequency over baseline, chest pain, shortness of breath, or other abdominal pain.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of type 1 diabetes mellitus, status post renal/pancreatic transplant, retinopathy, right retinal detachment status post re-attachment, hypertension, hyperlipidemia, paroxysmal atrial fibrillation (in sinus rhythm for a while), chronic right otitis media, history of ear tube placement, gout, and a history of bacterial meningitis years ago.
medical_history.social_history: Non-smoker, no illicit drug use, occasional alcohol consumption (< 1 drink per week), married, working.
